boardgame.name: Rolling Freight
boardgame.description: Rolling Freight is a route building and cargo shipping game in which dice represent each player_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s resource pool. Players spend these dice to purchase and complete rail contracts, deliver cargo, and improve their companies_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo; competitive abilities. Who can build the best rail network and deliver the most profitable goods? Get rolling and find out!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players begin the game with a pool of six dice with multi-colored sides. On each turn, a player can spend his or her dice to purchase contracts, construct rail links, build switching stations, purchase improvements and deliver one cargo of passengers or freight. Unused dice can be converted into stockpile markers for future use. By purchasing improvements, players can gain more dice with special abilities, become more efficient at laying rail or stockpiling dice, or increase the points they receive when other players deliver cargo over their rails. Bonus points are awarded for delivering passengers quickly or delivering freight over long distances._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The large, two-sided, colorful board has two maps. The western U.S. map, from the California gold rush era, is designed for 2 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; 4 players. With many double-track routes, this map allows newer players to effectively plan their networks and maximize deliveries. The southeastern U.S. map, depicting the late Nineteenth Century, has only single-track routes that are significantly interwoven. This provides more advanced strategic options and is intended for 3 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; 5 experienced players._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 33 - Discussing Area Control/Majority with Two Players
Episode 76-- Spiel des Jahres chat and What we have been playing With guests Joel Eddy and Paul Owen

APE Games (APE1000) Rolling Freight is a game of building rail and shipping routes, and moving cargo across those routes. Each turn players roll custom dice to perform actions such as purchasing route contracts, completing routes, making improvements, and moving cargo.Winning will require just the right mix of all these elements so hop aboard and roll some freight!

Rolling Freight, new in shrink. --- Georgia sales tax applies to customers with delivery addresses within the state. The amount is determined by the delivery location. For our customers in Atlanta: - You may pay in person with cash or credit card, or online with a credit card via WePay - You may pick up your purchase at no extra charge, either at one of our weekly gaming meetups (gameswellplayed.com/meetups) or at our home in Candler Park - For $3.00 we will deliver your entire order to any location inside or near the Perimeter Shipping options outside Atlanta: - You may pay online with a credit card via WePay - For $15.30 we will ship your game USPS Priority Mail. This is a flat rate and we will add other items to your shipment at no additional cost when possible
